lines.text: So that's your system?
Can you suggest a better one?
I suggest using your head a little.
That'd be nice work for you, Oscar, if you could get it.
Uuuhhh!

[Surprised by Oscar's sudden surprising appearance on Catalina by sneaking up behind her]
Oscar Piper!
Little moments from the lives of great detectives - Hildegarde, ya get screwier every day.
Come all the way from New York just to be stupid in new surroundings?
We've never had a murder here on the island. In fact, people don't even die here very often.
Maybe they die, and you don't know it.
Well, where's the corpse?

[Faking befuddlement]
Now let me see - what did I do with that corpse? Oh, the police station! Come on, Oscar!
Just a minute, it'll keep until after lunch, won't it?
Well, I hope so.
I never look at a corpse on an empty stomach. Com'on.
Hmmmm.

[to Hildegarde and Oscar]
That body was here when I came in at one o'clock this morning. Someone must have stolen it.

[Sarcastically]
I meant to tell yuh, Hildegarde. One of the first things to remember about handling a murder case is always keep in touch with your corpse.
Uhhhh! Will you please to mind your own business! I'll tackle this myself. This is a man's job.
[He walks away]
That's what I'm afraid of!

[to the dog Mr. Jones, who has helped Hildegarde find a clue]
If there is any justice, you should have a kennel and a tree in the heart of Scotland Yard.

[Frustrated]
I'm going to make one of these mugs talk if I have to work on 'em with a rubber hose!

[Sarcastically]
A very original idea for a policeman!

[after the doctor, who has just come from the beach in an old-fashioned swimsuit, says it's a natural death]
Are you quite capable of judging?
Well, I ought to be - I am a doctor!
Well, I took you for a lifeguard.

[With indignance]
I gave him a very thorough examination.

[Sarcastically]
I can imagine!
I resent your attitude, madame!

[Remarking on his bizarre bathing suit]
Don't try to be impressive in that drape, young man. You can't frighten me until you put on your trousers.

[She clears her throat]
Mr. Britt, here is a list of all the persons on the plane... names, addresses, and occupations.
Well, thanks for going to so much trouble.

[Sarcastically]
Yeah, meddling is a pleasure for some people.
